text: PBS Kids (stylized as PBS KIDS) is the branding used for nationally distributed children's programming carried by the U.S. public television network PBS. The brand encompasses a daytime block. PBS Kids programs are typically targets children ages 3–12. The educational status to use science, math and reading, some of them also include social studies. All of the programs give a problem that the children have to solve to remember the importance of sharing. ==Programming== For list of all PBS Kids programs, see List of programs broadcast by PBS Kids. ===Programming blocks=== ====Current==== * PBS Kids Family Night (April 21, 2017 – present) – an evening programming block airing encores of PBS Kids films and specials, and themed mini-marathons, typically from 7 to 9 p.m. during the weekends (formerly also on Fridays). Exclusive to the 24/7 PBS Kids Channel. ====Former==== * The Game (October 7, 1996 – September 6, 1999) – an afternoon PTV programming block aimed at elementary school children. * PBS Kids Bookworm Bunch (September 30, 2000 – September 5, 2004) – a Saturday morning block consisting of six animated series co-produced by the Canadian animation studio, Nelvana Limited. * PBS Kids Go! (October 11, 2004 – October 7, 2013) – an afternoon programming block aimed at elementary school children. * PBS Kids Preschool Block (September 4, 2006 – October 7, 2013) – a morning programming block aimed at preschool children. ==References== Category:1990s establishments Category:1990s establishments in the United States Category:1994 establishments Category:1994 establishments in the United States Category:American television networks Category:PBS Kids Category:Public Broadcasting Service Category:Television networks
title: PBS Kids
